title: Teesworks freeport project ‘secretive and poorly governed’
description: A high-profile levelling-up project, championed by Rishi Sunak and Michael Gove, is secretive, poorly governed and is failing to protect public money, a damning report has concluded. An independent investigation into the regeneration of the Redcar steelworks in Teesside found that taxpayers had so far paid more than £500 million to convert the site into one of the country’s first freeports.

title: Rwanda Bill clears first Lords hurdle as Archbishop Of Canterbury issues warning
description: The Most Rev Justin Welby accused the Government of outsourcing the country’s ‘legal and moral responsibilities’.

title: British PM Sunak wins first vote in House of Lords on new Rwanda asylum law

title: Rwanda: 'We can as a nation do better', says Archbishop of Canterbury as bill passes latest Lords hurdle
description: Justin Welby says plans to deport asylum seekers to the African nation is "leading the nation down a damaging path". But peers nod the scheme through - for now.

title: Rishi Sunak's Rwanda bill clears first hurdle in the House of Lords
description: Bill has cleared its first major hurdle in the House of Lords, after peers voted 206 to 84, majority 122, against a motion designed to block it.

description: Despite his demanding schedule as Prime Minister, Mr Sunak said avoiding eating for 36 hours at the start of each week is good for a 'balanced lifestyle'.

title: Nottingham attacks: Police face probe over killer's alleged assaults
description: A police force which was investigating alleged assaults by a triple killer weeks before the Nottingham attacks has referred itself to the watchdog. Barnaby Webber and Grace O'Malley-Kumar, both 19, were fatally stabbed on 13 June along with Ian Coates, 65. Valdo Calocane was given a hospital order for the killings on Thursday.

title: Kemi Badenoch is part of Tory WhatsApp group chat called 'Evil Plotters'
description: Kemi Badenoch is part of a Tory WhatsApp group called "Evil Plotters", according to bombshell reports. The Business and Trade Secretary insisted just yesterday that she doesn't want to topple Rishi Sunak and told Tory plotters to "stop messing around". But in a shock twist it has emerged Ms Badenoch is a member of an "Evil Plotters" group chat, the Guardian revealed.

title: Rishi Sunak says fasting is an ‘important discipline for me’
description: He may have a demanding schedule as Prime Minister, but Rishi Sunak has described intermittent fasting as being an “important discipline” for his “balanced lifestyle”. Mr Sunak typically avoids eating on Mondays as part of a health drive which he said helps to combat his “weakness for sugary things”.

title: Nottingham victims’ families say Rishi Sunak has not ruled out public inquiry
description: The victims’ families have backed calls for a public inquiry. Rishi Sunak has previously resisted them but it emerged on Monday night that he told the families at a meeting in Downing Street that he had not ruled out an inquiry. Mr Webber’s father ...

title: Disposable vapes to be banned and flavours limited to tackle ‘alarming’ rise in children vaping
description: Rishi Sunak has set out plans to ban disposable vapes after a steep rise in the number of children taking up vaping. It’s already illegal to sell vapes to anyone under 18 and the government also wants to limit flavours and end the use of colourful ...

title: Tory grandee Ken Clarke savages Rwanda Bill: ‘It’s like saying all dogs are cats’
description: Tory grandee Ken Clarke has savaged Rishi Sunak’s Rwanda laws with a warning that they risk moving the UK towards an “elected dictatorship”. The former chancellor reversed his previous support for legislation related to the controversial deportation deal, warning that the Prime Minister’s latest move was a “a step too far”.

title: Rishi Sunak hits back at Liz Truss after she called smoking ban ‘profoundly unconservative’
description: Prime Minister seeking to prevent anyone now aged 15 or under from ever legally buying cigarettes and to ban single-use vapes
